thread.title: USA Today calls Ship Island one of USA's `secret hidden gems'
thread.title_full: USA Today calls Ship Island one of USA's `secret hidden gems' | NOLA.com

author: Warren Kulo | GulfLive.com
title: USA Today calls Ship Island one of USA's `secret hidden gems'
text:
USA Today selected Ship Island as Mississippi's "secret hidden gem," on its list of such gems in each of the 50 states.Visit Mississippi photo
USA Today published a slide show Monday of what it considers "secret hidden gems" in each of the U.S. 50 states.
"These lesser-known attractions are all worth a visit as you travel the USA," authors wrote, "whether it's on the opposite side of the country or right near home."
Ship Island in the Gulf of Mexico was selected as Mississippi's "hidden gem." Although the island is actually owned by the U.S. National Park Service, it is commonly associated with the Mississippi coast.
"There's much more to the Mississippi Gulf Coast than gaming and nightlife," the story reads. "If you're looking to get away from it all, take a trip to Ship Island: You might start to imagine you are basking in the sun on some isolated tropical isle."
Mississippi's western neighbor, Louisiana, had the park rangers at the New Orleans Jazz National Historic Park selected as its hidden gem. USA Today noted all the rangers are musicians and visitors can watch them perform or participate in jazz yoga each week.
To the east, Alabama's Five Rivers Delta Museum in Spanish Fort was selected, with authors noting "is the ultimate place to soak up the natural beauty and incredible history of the region."
The entire list can be seen here .
